content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Sure, here is a function in Julia that should do the job:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = Markdown.parse(md, flavor=Markdown.GFM())::Markdown.MD
    julia_code = filter(x -> isa(x, Markdown.Code), code_blocks.content)
    extracted_code = join(map(x -> replace(x.code, r"```julia\n|\n```" => ""), julia_code), "\n\n")
    return extracted_code
end
```

This function uses the Markdown.jl package to parse the markdown document. It then filters out the code blocks and removes the code fences. Finally, it joins the code blocks together with a newline.
